docs.lead_paragraph: Most of the Democratic and Republican 2008 possible contenders are appearing today before the International Firefighters Assocation's forum, with one conspicuous absence.
docs.abstract: The international firefighters hear from nearly all the 2008 field today, with one major candidate -- Rudy Giuliani -- conspicuously absent.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Empire Zone column this morning, acting insurance superintendent Eric Dinallo says the Spitzer administration is seeking to reclaim prior approval before increases of health insurance rates. Right now, insurers can raise rates on their own, and the Insurance Department is limited in what it can do retroactively. Hence, double digit increases have become a common practice.
docs.abstract: Spitzer administration seeks control over health insurance rate increases.
docs.snippet: Spitzer administration seeks control over health insurance rate increases.

docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth Group, the health-insurance giant, said on Monday it would acquire Sierra Health Services for $2.6 billion, or $43.50 in cash per share, to help it expand in the fast-growing Southwest. Sierra provides health benefits and services to 310,000 members in Nevada and 320,000 customers throughout the United States.

headline.main: UnitedHealth to Buy Sierra Health for $2.6 Billion

docs.abstract: UnitedHealth Group, the health-insurance giant, said on Monday it would acquire Sierra Health Services for $2.6 billion, or $43.50 in cash per share, to help it expand in the fast-growing Southwest. docs.lead_paragraph: You would think that Gov. Eliot Spitzer, who is Jewish, would be exempt from reminders about attending church on Sunday, but that is what happened - indirectly - during a visit to Abyssinian Baptist Church in Harlem on Sunday morning.
docs.abstract: Governor Spitzer explains why his wife, Silda Wall Spitzer, did not join him at church.
